results.title: A Star is born
results.creator_credit: Cine Service and Standard Motor Products Ltd
results.brief_description: The story of the Vanguard Spacemaster with long low lines, an impressive front end and new body panels that give new and bigger doors. Special features of the external bodywork, the chassis, engine, internal fittings and actual performance on the road are illustrated.

results.title: A Stamp is born
results.brief_description: The manufacture of Australian postage stamps; the initial work of artists and master engravers; examination of the first proof copies; the preparation of plates used in the printing processes, the making of special printing inks; inspection of the finished product. The film concludes with views of important postal issues.

results.title: A Stake in the soil
results.brief_description: This video aims to increase awareness of the soil and its importance to mankind. It describes the development of soil science, and the history of the American Prairie and the Russian Steppe. Soil science owes much to Vasilii Dokuchaev, a professor of mineralogy at the University of St Petersburg who, in the 1880’s, became intrigued by the idea of soil as a living medium. ‘A Stake in soil’ follows Dokuchaev’s work, travelling to America where awareness was sharpened by the ‘dustbowl’ events in the 1930’s. The program also briefly covers the natural forces which impact on soil; wind and water erosion and drought, and the farming techniques that have contributed to this burden, such as the removal of fences and trees as windbreaks, deep ploughing and excessive animal grazing.

results.title: A Sporting year
results.creator_credit: Associated British-Pathe and British Travel Association
results.brief_description: A newsreel compilation of the main sporting events in Britain in 1963, including international athletics at the White City Stadium, tennis at Wimbledon , cricket at Lords and the Football Cup Finals at Wembley.

results.title: A Sporting chance
results.creator_credit: Jack Zalkalns, Anne Whitehead and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: This film aims to counter the image that “horses sweat, men perspire, but ladies only glow” by encouraging young girls to actively particpate in sport and physical activities. Explores the influence of sex role conditioning in determining the traditionally rigid limits within which girls have been able to find physical expression.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jack Zalkalns, Anne Whitehead and Tasmanian Film Corporation

results.title: A Spoonful of sugar
results.brief_description: The network of cane farms and sugar mills in the valleys along the Queensland coast, which is the basis of the Australian sugar industry. The film shows something of the life of the cane cutters, and concludes with a demonstration of the whole process of extracting and refining sugar for the table.

results.title: A Spider builds his web = Netzbau dev kreuzspinne
results.brief_description: An example of a German teaching film designed for use at University level. Detailed close-up views of the methods used by the spider show his technique of “spot welding” individual strands of the web. Various experiments on destruction of the web show the repair work undertaken by the spider. The film concludes with views of the spider eating the web he has so carefully constructed. Silent film with German subtitles.

results.title: A Song of Ceylon
results.brief_description: This film refers not only to Basil Wright’s classic British documentary “The Song of Ceylon” but also to a name erased from the map of the world, for there is no country officially named Ceylon. Invoking this idea of absence the above film pursues a certain phantasy of the body, a somewhat abstract form of the body in extremis, the body in travail, the body in torsion. The extremity in question is around forms of hysteria. A Song of Ceylon explores the narcissistic body, the masochistic body, the hysterical body and maybe a few other bodies in extremis. This is done by bringing together two different theatrical traditions from two different cultures through the mediation of cinematography.
